seo.title: किएसा नुओवा / बार इंटरनाज़ियोनाले बस स्टॉप → होस्टल ब्रिकेट
seo.description: पोसितानो बस से आ रहे हैं? किएसा नुओवा / बार इंटरनाज़ियोनाले (होस्टल ब्रिकेट के सबसे करीब) पर उतरें। ड्राइवर को संकेत दें, स्टॉप पहचानें, रिसेप्शन तक 2-5 मिनट पैदल चलें।

linkLabel: किएसा नुओवा / बार इंटरनाज़ियोनाले से होस्टल ब्रिकेट (आगमन)
intro:
2026 में SITA बस से आ रहे हैं? **किएसा नुओवा / बार इंटरनाज़ियोनाले बस स्टॉप** होस्टल ब्रिकेट के सबसे करीब का स्टॉप है, जिसमें सबसे छोटी पैदल दूरी और सबसे कम सीढ़ियां हैं। यह गाइड स्टॉप के बारे में है: इसे कैसे पहचानें, यह सुनिश्चित करें कि बस वास्तव में रुकती है, और रिसेप्शन तक के अंतिम 120-140 मीटर कैसे चलें।

यह पूरी बस यात्रा की गाइड नहीं है — यह आगमन का अंतिम, महत्वपूर्ण हिस्सा है: स्टॉप कैसा दिखता है, बटन कब दबाना है, और लंबे सीढ़ी मार्गों को लिए बिना अपने बैग होस्टल तक कैसे ले जाएं। आपको अंत में FAQ में आगमन आवश्यकताएं (लगेज स्टोरेज, चेक-इन समय, और देर से आगमन विकल्प) भी मिलेंगे।

image.alt: Positano’s Chiesa Nuova / Bar Internazionale SITA bus stop on Viale Pasitea
image.caption: This stop is called “Positano (Chiesa Nuova)” on timetables and sits outside Bar Internazionale on Viale Pasitea.

sections.title: Why Chiesa Nuova / Bar Internazionale is the best arrival stop
body: Positano has multiple bus stops. The one that makes hostel arrivals easiest is **Chiesa Nuova / Bar Internazionale** — it’s the closest stop to Hostel Brikette and avoids walking much further from the Positano Sponda bus stop, or long stair climbs you’ll face if you somehow end up at the “Positano Centro” bus stop.
From this stop it’s a short, mostly flat walk (about 120–140 metres) plus the hostel entrance steps. That’s why we recommend it for **luggage**, **tired legs**, and **first‑time arrivals**.
If you’re planning your broader arrival, see our %LINK:howToGetToPositano|How to get to Positano% guide, then use this page for the final stop and the last 2–5 minutes on foot.

images.caption: Look for the SITA stop marker outside Bar Internazionale.

sections.title: Fast facts (2026 season)
body: **Walk time:** 2–5 minutes from the stop to reception, depending on luggage and traffic.
**Distance:** ~120–140 metres along Viale Pasitea, then a short staircase up to the hostel entrance.
**Stop type:** Request stop — tell the driver and press the stop button early.
**When to prepare to exit:** Stand and move toward the door 1–2 minutes before Chiesa Nuova, especially if the bus is busy.
**Best for:** First‑time arrivals, heavy bags, and anyone who wants the least stairs.
**Tickets:** You can’t buy SITA tickets from the driver — get them in advance (see %LINK:sitaTickets|SITA ticket basics%).
**Peak crowd times:** Late morning and late afternoon can be busy in summer; if a bus is full, wait for the next one rather than trying to squeeze on with bags.
**If you’re unsure on board:** Ask the driver or a nearby passenger — this is a common stop for hostel guests and day‑trippers.
**If you’re arriving by ferry first:** Use the %LINK:ferryDockToBrikette|ferry dock → Hostel Brikette% guide to reach this stop without hauling bags up the beach stairs.

images.alt: A small local bus used on the Positano route
images.caption: Local buses are compact and often crowded — position yourself near the door before your stop.

sections.title: How to get off at the right stop (what to look for on the bus)
body: On many routes, the driver (or an onboard display) announces the stop as **“Chiesa Nuova”**. On timetables it can also appear as **“Positano (Chiesa Nuova)”**. Locally, you’ll also hear people say **Chiesa Nuova / Bar Internazionale** because the stop is directly outside that cafe/tabacchi.
**Tell the driver when you board:** “Chiesa Nuova, per favore.” This is the simplest way to avoid missing the stop, especially if the bus is crowded or you’re arriving late in the day.
**Press the stop button early.** When you see Bar Internazionale approaching (often on your right as the bus heads through this bend), press the stop button so the driver has time to pull in.
**Signal the driver if you’re standing:** When the bus approaches, make eye contact and raise your hand so the driver knows you want to get off. This matters because Chiesa Nuova is a request stop.
If you’re standing with bags, start moving toward the door a minute before the stop — the bus may stop briefly and then continue quickly.
If you’re nervous about missing it, ask the driver one or two stops before: “Prossima Chiesa Nuova?” (Is Chiesa Nuova next?). Drivers are used to this question from visitors.

sections.title: What it looks like when you arrive (so you know where to get off)
body: The stop is **roadside on Viale Pasitea**, outside **Bar Internazionale**. Look for the bar/tabacchi frontage, a small cluster of people waiting on the pavement, and the blue‑white SITA stop sign.
The bus drops you directly onto the pavement. There is no raised platform — you step down to street level and the bus pulls out quickly.
If you’re unsure, ask another passenger or say “Chiesa Nuova?” to the driver — locals know this stop and it’s a common request for hostel guests.
Once you step off, you’ll see the main road continuing in both directions. The hostel is a short walk along the same road — you do **not** need to climb long staircases from this stop.
At busy times, you may see a small line of people waiting for the next bus on the same pavement. Stay to the inside edge so you’re not blocking traffic.

images.alt: Roadside bus stop marker outside Bar Internazionale in Positano
images.caption: The stop sits right outside Bar Internazionale on the main road.

sections.title: Walk from Chiesa Nuova / Bar Internazionale to Hostel Brikette (2–5 minutes)
body: Step off at street level outside Bar Internazionale and orient yourself on **Viale Pasitea** (the main road through Positano).
Walk along the paved sidewalk for roughly 120–140 metres. You’ll be walking along the main road — keep bags close and stay on the inside edge of the pavement when traffic is tight.
Look for the **Hostel Brikette** sign and the short staircase up to reception. Go up the steps to reach the front door.
If you’re using a porter, confirm whether they’ll meet you at the stop or bring bags directly to the hostel entrance so you can walk hands‑free.
If you’re carrying a large suitcase, take your time on the steps and pause at the landing if needed — it’s a short climb but it’s the only stairs on this route.

If you need a map view, use the %URL:https://www.google.com/maps/embed?pb=!1m28!1m12!1m3!1d755.2447449721735!2d14.479394!3d40.6295534!2m3!1f0!2f0!3f0!3m2!1i1024!2i768!4f13.1!4m13!3e2!4m5!1s0x133b976673927785%3A0x5187a720325ee588!2sBar%20Internazionale%2C%20Positano!3m2!1d40.629495!2d14.482264!4m5!1s0x133b97669dd0003b%3A0xf11f22a59b1b00da!2sHostel%20Brikette%2C%20Positano!3m2!1d40.629634!2d14.480818!5e0!3m2!1sen!2sit!4v1700000000000|map% for the exact bend and staircase.

images.caption: The entrance is up a short staircase from the main road.

sections.title: Tickets, bags, and ride basics (quick notes)
body: You cannot buy SITA tickets from the driver. Buy tickets in advance at a tabacchi/newsstand (Bar Internazionale can help), then validate or show the ticket when you board. For the full guide, see %LINK:sitaTickets|SITA tickets and validation%.
If there’s a validator machine inside the bus, scan your ticket as you step on. If you’re unsure, hold the ticket up and show it to the driver — they’ll indicate what to do.
Tickets are small paper slips — keep them somewhere easy to reach and avoid folding or wetting them before you board.

Buses can be crowded in summer and after ferry arrivals. If the bus is full, the driver may not take additional passengers — the next bus is usually not far behind, but in peak season it can still feel slow. Plan for flexibility.
Keep your ticket accessible so you can show it quickly when boarding. If you’re traveling as a group, have everyone ready to board together to avoid delaying the bus.
If you’re arriving with large luggage, consider a %LINK:porterServices|porter service% to move bags from the stop to the hostel while you walk up.
For broader public transport tips (passes, budget planning, and seasonality), see %LINK:publicTransportAmalfi|public transport on the Amalfi Coast% and %LINK:transportBudget|transport budget tips%.

images.alt: Bus stop area on the coastal road in Positano
images.caption: Most SITA stops are simple roadside pull‑ins with a small sign — keep bags close and be ready to board.

sections.title: Arriving by ferry first? Here’s how this stop fits in
body: If your journey starts at the beach‑level ferry dock, your easiest luggage‑friendly route is usually: ferry dock → porter service → Interno Positano bus → **Chiesa Nuova / Bar Internazionale** → short walk to the hostel.
We walk that route step‑by‑step in %LINK:ferryDockToBrikette|ferry dock → Hostel Brikette (with luggage)% — it’s the most common arrival path for guests in peak season.
Already at the beach and want the simplest climb? Use the bus to reach Chiesa Nuova, then follow the short walk described in this guide.

Skipping the porter service is possible with light bags, but the walk from the beach to this stop includes a steady uphill stretch — most guests prefer to save energy for the final steps to the hostel.

images.alt: Positano ferry dock and beach promenade with boats in the bay
images.caption: Ferry arrivals happen at beach level — the bus makes the uphill leg easier.

images.alt: Positano beachfront promenade leading toward Piazza dei Mulini
images.caption: From the dock, most arrivals walk toward Piazza dei Mulini before catching the bus up.

sections.title: Arriving at night or after a long travel day
body: Evening arrivals can feel more disorienting because the road is darker and traffic is still active. The stop is still the same roadside pull‑in outside Bar Internazionale, so use the bar as your anchor point.

If you’re carrying luggage, move slowly along the pavement and keep to the inside edge. The walk is short, but being calm and deliberate is better than trying to rush on a narrow sidewalk after a long travel day.
If it’s raining or windy, wait under the bar awning until the bus is fully stopped, then step down carefully — the pavement can feel slick with travel shoes and heavy bags.

sections.title: If you arrive early or need a breather
body: Bar Internazionale is right at the stop and is the most convenient place to wait if you arrive early or need a quick coffee and shade. It’s also a good place to check that you’re at the correct stop.
If you arrive with luggage, keep it with you and avoid blocking the pavement — buses and scooters pass close to the curb.
If you’re tired or jet‑lagged, take a moment to check the map before walking so you don’t overshoot the hostel sign.
If you need help, you can message the hostel or check the %LINK:checkinCheckout|check-in & checkout guide% for current reception hours and arrival options.

sections.title: Accessibility and street‑safety tips
body: The Chiesa Nuova / Bar Internazionale stop minimizes stairs, which is why we recommend it for most arrivals. The only steps on this route are the short staircase up to the hostel entrance.
Viale Pasitea can be busy and the sidewalk narrows in places. Keep luggage on the inside edge, walk single‑file if needed, and avoid stopping on the road side of the pavement.
If you’re traveling with heavy bags, a stroller, or limited mobility, consider a %LINK:porterServices|porter service% so you can focus on the short walk without lifting luggage.
If you need to pause, step into the recessed doorway near the bar or wait just beyond the stop so you’re out of the traffic flow.

sections.title: If you got off at the wrong Positano stop
body: If you accidentally get off at **Positano Centro** or **Spiaggia Grande / Positano Spiaggia**, expect a much steeper climb with significantly more stairs to reach the hostel.
The simplest fix is to take a local bus or taxi up to **Chiesa Nuova / Bar Internazionale**, then follow the short walk in this guide.
If you’re unsure where you are, open the map and aim for Bar Internazionale — it’s the landmark for this stop.
If you’re carrying heavy bags and already feel stuck, consider pausing at a café or asking a local to point you toward the Bar Internazionale stop — it’s a very common reference point in Positano.

beforeList: Tell the driver “Chiesa Nuova, per favore” when you board and press the stop button early.
Buy or validate your ticket before boarding (see %LINK:sitaTickets|SITA tickets%).
Keep your phone charged so you can check the map or message the hostel if needed.
stepsList: Get off at Chiesa Nuova / Bar Internazionale (roadside stop outside the bar/tabacchi).
Walk along Viale Pasitea for about 120–140 metres on the pavement.
Look for the Hostel Brikette sign and take the short staircase up to reception.
kneesList: The route avoids long staircases — it’s mostly pavement plus the short entrance staircase.
If you’re carrying heavy bags, consider a %LINK:porterServices|porter service% pickup/drop‑off at Chiesa Nuova / Bar Internazionale.

faqs.q: How do I know I’m at the right stop?
faqs.a: You’re looking for the roadside stop outside **Bar Internazionale** on Viale Pasitea. On bus announcements/timetables it’s typically called **“Positano (Chiesa Nuova)”** — locals also refer to it as Chiesa Nuova / Bar Internazionale.

faqs.q: Do I need to press a button for the bus to stop?
faqs.a: Yes — treat it as a request stop. Tell the driver “Chiesa Nuova, per favore” when you board, and press the stop button when you see Bar Internazionale approaching so the driver has time to pull in.

faqs.q: How long does the walk take?
faqs.a: About 2–5 minutes, depending on luggage and traffic, for roughly 120–140 metres.

faqs.q: Can I store my luggage before check-in?
faqs.a: Usually yes — luggage storage is available from 10:30 for guests checking in (subject to space). If you arrive before 10:30, you may need to wait at Bar Internazionale and come up when we open. Full details are in the %LINK:luggageStorage|luggage storage guide%.

faqs.q: What are the check-in times, and what do I need to check in?
faqs.a: Regular check‑in is from 15:00 to 22:30. Bring your original ID (passport/ID card). At check‑in you’ll need a €10 cash deposit for your keycard + linen set (refunded in cash when you return both at checkout). Full details: %LINK:checkinCheckout|check-in & checkout guide%.

faqs.q: What if I arrive after reception closes?
faqs.a: Reception closes at 22:30. If you’ll arrive later, message us before you travel — depending on the day we may be able to offer a self‑service late check‑in.

howtoSteps: Get off at Positano Chiesa Nuova / Bar Internazionale (closest stop to the hostel)
Tell the driver “Chiesa Nuova, per favore” and press the stop button early
Walk 120–140 metres along Viale Pasitea and take the entrance steps to reception
If you’re unsure, ask at Bar Internazionale or check the map for the hostel sign
